rules: Rule1: If the health agency achieves outbreak control, then the health agency contains disease spread.
Rule2: Provided that the testing platform detects infected cases, the health agency controls outbreak.
Rule3: Whenever contact tracing identifies exposure chain, the health agency controls outbreak.
Rule4: Under the condition that the lab tool analyzes samples, the lab tool confirms diagnosis.
Rule5: The lab tool analyzes samples or the testing platform reports results.
Rule6: Whenever the testing platform reports results, the health agency issues an advisory.
Rule7: If the testing platform alerts the health agency, then either the testing platform detects infected cases or contact tracing identifies exposure chain.
Rule8: Provided that the health agency notifies the public, the testing platform alerts the health agency.
Rule9: Under the condition that the health agency issues an advisory, the health agency notifies the public.
Rule10: If the health agency monitors disease outbreak, then assuming the health agency does not control outbreak, the health agency does not use a mobile app.
Rule11: Under the condition that the government coordinates response, the government monitors compliance.
Rule12: If the government allocates resources, then assuming the government coordinates response, under the condition that the government implements quarantine, the government closes borders.
Rule13: If the government mobilizes teams, then provided that the government coordinates response, under the condition that the government implements quarantine, the government closes borders.
Rule14: Whenever the government provides funding, the government allocates resources.
Rule15: Either the government provides funding or the government supplies equipment.
Rule16: Provided that the government supplies equipment, the government mobilizes teams.
Rule17: If the government enforces measures, then under the condition that the government implements quarantine, the government closes borders.
Rule18: Under the condition that the health agency deploys testing platform, the health agency monitors disease outbreak.
Rule19: Either the health agency delays response or the government does not violate protocols.
Rule20: If the authority investigates negligence, then the health agency does not delay response.
Rule21: The authority investigates negligence or the authority audits procedures.
Rule22: Provided that the authority audits procedures, the health agency does not delay response.
Rule23: The health agency implements contact tracing or the health agency deploys testing platform.
Rule24: Either the health agency activates emergency plan or the health agency does not implement contact tracing.
Rule25: The health agency declares public emergency or the health agency does not activate emergency plan.
Rule26: If the government bans alcohol sales, then alcohol consumption does not allow public gathering.
Rule27: Either the government bans alcohol sales or the government restricts alcohol distribution.
Rule28: If it is not the case that the government monitoring compliance implies the government enforces measures, then the government faces legal challenge.
Rule29: Provided that it is not the case that the government restricting alcohol distribution implies alcohol consumption does not allow public gathering, the health agency achieves outbreak control.

Rule30: If it is not the case that the government not monitoring compliance implies the government not enforcing measures implies the government does not face legal challenge, then the government violates protocols.
Rule31: If the health agency does not control outbreak, then the health agency uses a mobile app.
Rule32: Under the condition that the health agency does not control outbreak, the government implements quarantine.
Rule33: Whenever the health agency does not control outbreak, alcohol consumption allows public gathering.
Rule34: Provided that the health agency does not control outbreak, the government does not close borders.
facts: Fact2: The health agency does not contain disease spread.
Fact3: The lab tool does not confirm diagnosis.
Fact4: The health agency does not declare public emergency.
